revised_title: On the Electrochemical Equivalent of Silver and the Absolute Electromotive Force of Clark Cells
tldr: The authors investigate the electrochemical equivalent of silver and the absolute electromotive force of Clark cells. They develop a method for measuring electric currents directly, without relying on knowledge of the force of terrestrial magnetism, and determine the electrochemical equivalent of silver using silver voltameters. The results provide a convenient standard for verifying current-measuring instruments and improving the accuracy of electromotive force measurements.
